Question.Text: A 35-year-old Caucasian man presents to a clinic with fever, rash/lesion on his neck associated with massive neck swelling and fatigue. The patient recalls a break in the skin at the site of the lesion 3 days before.

Answer: Cutaneous anthrax - The patient presents with a skin lesion that developed from a skin break, associated with massive neck swelling (malignant edema), fever, and fatigue. The images show the characteristic painless black eschar (necrotic ulcer) with surrounding edema and Bacillus anthracis bacteria on microscopy, typical of cutaneous anthrax from spore-forming bacteria exposure.
